amendment.description: Amendments sought to exempt from the provisions of the bill Federal laws that enforce or establish limits on the introduction into U.S. waters of pollutants that cause significant adverse acute affects on human health, cancer or developmental malformations, reproductive dysfunctions, neurological disorders, genetic mutations, or other chronic effects on human health which are serious or irreversible.
amendment.purpose: An amendment (comprised of amendments numbered 35 and 36 as printed in the Congressional Record) to provide that the bill would not apply to laws or regulations that enforce or establish limits on the introduction into U.S. waters of pollutants that cause significant adverse acute affects on human health, cancer or developmental malformations, reproductive dysfunctions, neurological disorders, genetic mutations, or other chronic effects on human health which are serious or irreversible.

action.text: On agreeing to the Borski amendments (A017) Failed by recorded vote: 162 - 263 (Roll no. 61).
